website_summaries.verdict: Long lasting automatic toilet cleaning system that should last up to 3 months.
pros: Installation is easy, as the system should fit most designs of toilets
Refill units are sold separately, so you don't have to toss the entire system when it's empty
Not as harsh for the toilet as some bleach tablets
cons: A little more expensive than some other automatic toilet cleaning options

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: The advertising of this product is very misleading. It does nothing to keep your toilet bowl clean. We've had it installed for over a month with no evidence of helpful results. We cleaned the bowl before installing the device and noted brown stains over the entire underwater surface within two weeks after installation. I've used the blue and uncolored refills with similar results. At the price of $21+ and the cost of refill cartridges, this is a giant rip-off to consumers.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Boneske

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for keeping bowls clean
customer_reviews.text: I've installed these in all six toilets in my home and they are a great idea. I've been using this for about 4-5 years. This device circulates bleach product into the toilet bowl after every flush where it is needed to prevent staining such as water lines from calcium build up. However the chlorine water is restricted to the bowl, not the tank. If chlorine is in the tank it will erode away the "flapper" and foam seal which separates the tank from the bowl, requiring more expensive repairs. This product solves that problem with no drawbacks and don't look unsightly like the clamp-on bars of chlorine that are permanently inside the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D123

customer_reviews.title: One Star is for the Blue Cartridge the Bleach Unit is 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have this in bleach and someone mentioned if you use the blue you will know when to replace the cartridge. The Blue stained our toilet bowl with a blueish tint. The stain is a very light blue ring at water level. There is also lines of blue from the water outlets that empty into the bowl . The bleach unit in the pother bathroom has been working fine and it does cut down on the cleaning quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: SW Florida

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it! Please read.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this since 2018. Now the bleach cartridges are not available and the blue inserts are useless. I have had them 2 weeks since the bleach went out of stock and have had to clean my toilet every other day since installing it. Save yourself some money and get the Kaboom system which uses tablets instead of wasteful cartridges. Then you can also use regular bromine tablets, which really work good without the smell of chlorine.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Well, first, I had to work to make ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, first, I had to work to make the line fit, but I managed. Then, I noticed that it leaked out of the top, which would put bleach water into the tank, something I had hoped to avoid. Also, the tube from the unit had a kink that I couldn't fix due to the way it had been packaged. It was in a place that prohibited me from shortening it. The water in the bowl was substantially lower than previously (and after), and the instructions said that might happen if there were a kink in the supply hose. I wonder if that is really the cause or not. Either way, it had three strikes, so i threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: Complete Waste Of Money
customer_reviews.text: Does not work consistently. Sometimes it does (you see blue in the water) and sometimes nothing. I bought two, one for each bathroom. So I have spent a great deal of time switching them back and forth, swapping filters, since one bathroom seems to work better (both toilets are the same). But the one that works better is one that gets less use. The other is irritatingly, inconsistent. I've cut larger holes in the cartridges hoping for better flow. Didn't do any good. I called the company once and queried them about the inconsistency and was told sometimes you can't tell because the cartridge was manufactured differently. Really. That's a stupid answer. I've gone back to the blue tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Williams

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install, non-returnable
customer_reviews.text: This product requires some disassembly of the flush system inside the tank, and these systems are anything but standard. I have two toilets, each with a different flush mechanism, and this product wouldn't install securely on either one. It might be okay for the mechanically-inclined, but the rest of us are going to have a disabled toilet waiting for an expensive plumber's visit. To add insult to injury, the product is non-returnable. It's junk, money wasted. Save yours.
customer_reviews.author: Copwriter

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS out the top
customer_reviews.text: I put 2 of these in both my toilets and after a while I noticed that the rubber gasket at the base of my toilet (flapper housing) was starting to deteriorate (crumble) I discovered that the bleach mixture from this unit was leaking into my tank and my gasket (and maybe yours as well) doesn't like bleach or chlorine. The leak is at the top of the unit through a vent(?). There must be some kind of check valve in there that is not functioning as needed. I thought better of fluidmaster after using many of their products for over 30 years quite a letdown.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P.

customer_reviews.title: SO Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Since Fluidmaster makes such great fill valves, I decided to take a chance as I HATE that water line ring that forms in my toilet. Well, bought two of these in blue so I could really see when it was time to change the cartridge. I thoroughly cleaned both toilets and then did the simple installation. Within a week, the ring started to appear and continued to grow. Now I'm scrubbing my toilets weekly as soon as the rings start to appear - what this product claimed to eliminate the need to do. It simply does not do what it's supposed to do. :( Really disappointed in this product and would NOT recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawgfan1606

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Leaked out of the bottom on the first ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Leaked out of the bottom on the first flush. Tried to return amd it stated “no returns on this item”. Thanks for stealing my money. In the trash it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Turbovtwin

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Installed and working in less than five minutes. Probably closer to two. Remove fill hose, clip on back of tank, connect new hose to fill valve and down pipe, insert cartridge. Done. What I've noticed is that if you have several flushes in a row (guests over), then the blue will run out and will need some time to refresh before it's back on another flush. If there is supposed to be a scent, I'm not picking it up. Tanks seam to be staying clean longer, but still require a touch up with a brush after a few weeks. Might try the chlorine cartridge next to see of that works better. Another Amazon Warehouse find I'm happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Clever device
customer_reviews.text: Love this device because when it comes to dis-infecting toilet bowel - nothing beats bleach. Major downsides are you have to remember to replace the cartridges and if you have one in several different toilets installed at different times - you have to either set-up an elaborate reminder system (company actually offers an on-line reminder system through their website) or have to check each one regularly - and, the device itself wears out eventually - developing leaks. This you need to spot ASAP - because then the bleach gets into the tank and can cause havoc w/elements of the flushing system. Just re-installed a couple - -
customer_reviews.author: Avid Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Finally, the product I have been searching for. ( I hope)
customer_reviews.text: We have used every type of tablet that turn the water in the toilet blue, as well as those cling gel type things for inside the bowl. Every time we use them for a length of time, they impair flushing, or cause damage to the inside of the toilet parts. (Rubber flapper, and flush valve seal) This thing seems to be the real deal since it feeds the product directly into the bowl from the tank without ever touching the inside of the tank. ***Note, it takes the water sitting inside of it for about an hour before the first flush turned blue, I thought it was defective but it just takes time.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Vinson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product, but only cleaned for about two months
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well, but did not last three months. I think I've used it now for about one and a half months, and the toilet bowl is already starting to show stains. Make sure to clean your toilet thoroughly before you use it. The installation was very easy. I'm not the most handy person, but I was able to figure it out using the diagram in the directions. Overall, it's a pretty good product, as long as you're not banking on the tablet cleaner lasting for three months with regular use. If it's a toilet that gets lighter use, this may work for three months.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but not sure it works?
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were easy to follow and installation only took minutes. I had to trim the length of the tubes it comes with to make a better fit. I also removed the clip to the "out" flow tube and directly plugged it into the overflow pipe. It was easy to do and much more seamless. It took several hours for the blue coloring to show up in the bowl. The color saturation differs, sometimes it is a dark blue, but mostly it is just a light tint that I barely see. I'm concerned this an indicator that this is only effective when the water is a true blue.
customer_reviews.author: Sh0p4KiX

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep toilet clean.
customer_reviews.text: I have one of those water saver toilets. It was almost impossible to keep clean. While this cleaning system doesn't completely eliminate the problem, it helps a lot. Instead of needing to clean the bowl daily, I can clean it once a week. I liked it so much, I purchased one for my sister. One of the best features of this system is that it puts the cleaner directly into the water stream, instead of into the tank. You don't have to worry about it attacking the metal parts of the tank. It was easy to install. It is real easy to install and replace the cleaning cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Mikkel

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like this product......
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of this toilet tank product and crossed my fingers. The two I ordered in the white BLEACH seem to be working. They have been in the tank for 3 weeks and no slime or ring noticed. BUT, the other one I ordered in the BLUE has started to become slimy in the bowl and is making a blue ring around the bowl. The blue has been in the tank for only 2 weeks. The blue definitely doesn't work like the bleach (white). Thought I had finally found a product that was kinder to the inner workings of my toilets but maybe I will still be looking!
customer_reviews.author: C. krenkel

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not "self-cleaning"....  as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because of the "self-cleaning" statement I read here and on the internet. I'm here to tell (warn?) you that it is NOT self-cleaning. After only a month, the ring around the bowl was right back. This is no longer than the hand scrubbing I did before, and will apparently do again. If you like pretty blue and ease of installation buy it. If you want self-cleaning, keep searching. This is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: NO LOW FLOW
customer_reviews.text: This product does NOT work with low flow toilet systems. I wish they had put a notice about that before I wasted my money on them. I tried every way of installing it but no luck. The cleaning agent in the cartridge does not distribute.
customer_reviews.author: Len Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - but be cautious
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for over a month. Really like not having the weird pink furze growing in the bowl anymore. Noticeable smell of bleach, but if you're not overly sensitive to it, it's not a problem. (Be VERY careful taking it out of the package. I would recommend wearing nitrile gloves or something like that before touching the product, even while in the wrapping. I ended up getting some on the corner of my face, near my eye. Had to wash the area several times, and use aloe vera, etc. Burned for a day, still.)
customer_reviews.author: DKBlumchen

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I switched from the KaBoom system to the fluidmaster because the kabooms were getting frail and leaking water in the tank and I did not want any chemical in the holding tank water. I switched all three of my toilets to the fluidmaster 8300 system and have been happy so far. Both KaBoom and the Fluidmaster tablets clean good but the KaBoom has a slightly better smell right after flushing. One is about a year old and the plastic seems to be holding up well. I use the clear tablets in all three.
customer_reviews.author: WN

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you jiggle the cartridge occasionally
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well, does a good job at keeping my toilet clean. However, the 'blue' craps out pretty early due to bad design of the cartridge. When your water stops being blue what you need to do is *wait for the refill to stop* (important, or you'll get blue crud all over) then open the tank, and just unscrew the cartridge, swish it back and forwards a bit, then put it back in. You can do this about four times before it's actually empty, doubling or tripling its apparent life.
customer_reviews.author: sarusa

customer_reviews.title: I Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great product! It's easy to use and keeps the toilet clean between scrubbing. We have hard water and galvanized piping, so we still get stains that have to be cleaned, but it keeps the toilet white for quite a while, and makes it 1000X's easier to scrub. The best part is that you don't have to have something hanging in your bowl, or drop something in the tank. It also assists in keeping that hard to clean area beneath the rim fairly spotless. Really really good product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: This Fluidmaster 8300 solves the issue with other chlorinators that destroy the components in the tank by sending the chlorine into the main part of the tank. This one directly sends the chlorine down the overflow pipe during a flush, brilliant idea! Had one of these for several years on our downstairs bathroom, decided to add to the Master Bath and Guest Bath to keep them sparkling too. Easy to install, literally less than a minute!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Think twice...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these systems. One for each of our bathrooms. The cartridges they came with only lasted about 30 days. I ordered a 2 pack of refills and had the same result. I know the length of time they last is dependent on the usage but there are only two adults in our household, my husband and myself. Our master bath gets a bit more use than our 2nd bath does but not that much more. For what these systems cost and what you pay for the refills, they really aren’t worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Give it time to show blue in the bowl!
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky getting to fit in our Kohler low flow with the cylinder instead of flapper valve but it works. May modify with longer hose to allow me to slide housing farther to the right. Our toilets have ceramic tabs in the lid for centering. The middle tab hits the housing so I will slide it to the right. Think Fluidmaster should provide longer lengths of tubing to provide better fit. Remember to give the cartridges time to soak in the tank housing before trying to see the blue in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Toilet cleaner bubbly cleans your toilet ... No
customer_reviews.text: It's just a flush cleaner for the first few days and than back to regular water and visibly see that it needs cleaning. Not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Antonia Baccari

customer_reviews.title: Does a very nice job
customer_reviews.text: I delayed writing a review until the unit had been in service for a few months. It certainly seems to be doing a very good job and was well worth the money. It was not too difficult to install. Understandably there is a bit of a bleach smell, but it is fairly faint and not a problem at all. I am purchasing more of these for myself and other family members.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea a lot but I did break a toilet part
customer_reviews.text: ...in attaching the assembly. Those big in-tank tabs worked great on the bowl but made me have to replace the flapper every couple of months. Hopefully this will solve that. (I’ll increase the stars if it works great) BUT in trying to put the clip hose in I broke the PVC tube it is supposed to sit in. SO I have to replace that and maybe the whole inner toilet workings. Darn it. Also the tubing that went onto the other part was too small to fit so I took off the Fluidmaster tubing and used the old tubing on both ends.
customer_reviews.author: Book Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Keep Your toilets Clean
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these cleaners for over a year. they work great at keeping the bowl clean. I may be clean the inside of the bowl once every 6 months for the heck of it. No rings or mildew build up in the bowl. The tank water stays clean and fresh. There is a slight smell of bleach after you install them, but it is not that bad. It also dissipates over time. The small price to pay for a good product to work.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilkow

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Clean the whole bowl, Not seeing much Blue
customer_reviews.text: I quickly realized that this injects the blue cleaner through the tube that only feed the toiled refill, not the primary flush. This means none of the cleaner is used during the flush to clean the bowl from top to bottom. The cleaner only sits in the bowl after the flush. I also see very little blue cleaner seeping into the bowl. I'll see how it goes after a few months. Not sure if this is a keeper yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Gordon

customer_reviews.title: I got the blue and the chlorine version to compare ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the blue and the chlorine version to compare them both. They both keep the toilet clean from the "Ring" that appears normally due to our water conditions. We are home a lot, so they get used frequently. We are two people with three toilets and they have lasted three months with one cartridge. I bought some Rendezvous Brominating Tablets from Amazon, that I will try to insert in the cartridges, so as to save some $$$. If you get "the ring"...get this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Mesa Man

customer_reviews.title: Interferes with toilet tank cover
customer_reviews.text: After installing the Fluidmaster 8300 Flush 'n Sparkle Automatic Toilet Bowl Cleaning System, the toilet tank cover will not seat properly and wobbles. Unacceptable!
customer_reviews.author: Darrel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install Does Exactly What it Says....
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what it said it would do. Have well water, very hard and stains bowl. First it was super easy to install, took all of a minute, just like the package says. Second it works just like they say, no smell great product and won’t ruin the inside of your toilet works as the septic and bleach product does not touch the inner workings of your toilet...forget all else, especially things you toss into your upper tank...which ruins the flusher.
customer_reviews.author: eichs

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a little adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: The point is to reduce cost and effort of manual scrubbing, while protecting the seals of the toilet gaskets. This product does both well. With a little adjustment it is a lot cheaper in the cost of refill cartridges. I cut the bottom of the cartridge off, leaving just the part that threads and seals the water compartment. Now the aftermarket tablets on Amazon can easily be dropped in any time you need. I only use one at a time and they last over a month average between 3 toilets.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: modification to work with Toto valve and make cartridge last longer
customer_reviews.text: Brand new Toto toilet and Flush and sparkle restricted flow too much to fill bowl following flush. Solution: Add y fitting to incoming water line in tank to shunt some of incoming water directly to big tube for bowl refill water; and the rest to Flush and Sparkle unit (whose output also goes to same big tube for refill). Now Toto fill valve works right, toilet bowl refills fully, scent is subtler. Cartridge probably lasts longer because water flow through it is less per flush.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Legitimate one-star review.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a shill for a competitor or disgruntled in any way, but this POS is just awful. Within a day the blue gunk inside the filter was completely blocking water flow through it. I honestly thought the water to the house had been turned off and spent time finding out that wasn't true. I removed it and threw it out. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: MLT

customer_reviews.title: There's a better product out there
customer_reviews.text: I put Fluidmaster 8100 Flush 'N' Sparkle Toilet Bowel Cleaner in one of the bathrooms and a Kaboom system in the other. After 6 months of using each, the Kaboom FAR outperformed the Fluidmaster with my water conditions. Ring around the toilet (standing water level) pretty much disappeared with both products, but I'm finding lots of mold/mildew in the Fluidmaster one where the water comes out under the top lip of the toilet. I'm going with the one that works better!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Wanna clean the bowl less?
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that the water stains in the bowl are gone. I installed this literally in under a minute. No tools required. I cleaned the bowl, as usual, then allowed this to do the rest. Every flush carries the chemical through your bowl filler. I haven't seen new water stains in over a month. I usually see water stains within days. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good option
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for 2 years and they work great at keeping the toilet bowl clean longer between manual cleanings. The only issue I have had is that the unit itself will mold in the reservoir tank. Specifically the white connector tubing. It grows pink mildew and black mold in both of my tanks. I have to take them out and scrub them with bleach every once in a while. They really need to use better tubing on these, like something mold/mildew resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Don M Williams

customer_reviews.title: keep the toilet bowl clean longer
customer_reviews.text: During the summer months, it seemed I was cleaning the toilet bowl every day. I guess it's the warmer water permitting growth. ANyway, have tried "in the tank" bleach products and ended up replacing the rubber goods inside. This bypasses the tank & shoots bleach directly into toilet bowl, slowing the growth much. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and keeps my toilet clean.
customer_reviews.text: Love that bleach smell and it doesn't degrade the toilet hardware like the big chlorine tablets. Very easy to install. Just take your time and support the work. Easy to position within the tank. IF your connection is larger than the flex tube, carefully and GENTLY heat the tip of the flex tube to get it to slide onto the fitting. It doesn't need a lot of heat!
customer_reviews.author: jose fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Price jump
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough but a 60% increase for refill cartridges is too much. Amazon no longer carries the refill cartridges, we have to purchase through an Amazon 3rd party. I felt the cartridges were high at the original price of $10 but $16 is no value. I'll return to chlorine tablets and remove the units from my toilets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke part of the toilet installing this.
customer_reviews.text: A 10 dollar item, ended up costing another $10 to fix the toilet. The old part snapped off. Had to run to the home store to get a replacement part. Hopefully it was worth it. Seems to be working so far. The water is blue and I do not smell any scent. I will update this review after a couple of months with my findings.
customer_reviews.author: DONE

customer_reviews.title: Fluidmaster 8300P8 Flush'N' Sparkle Bleach Kit
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one a few months ago and have liked it so much that we ordered another one. They work great. The don't have an oder, keep the toilets mold free, and so easy to install. We have a septic tank and this doesn't interfere with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Vand

customer_reviews.title: Best system I've found for keeping your toilet bowl clean
customer_reviews.text: This is the best system I've found for keeping your toilet bowl clean. I have four of these. Unlike those big bleach looking tablets I've used in the past, this device just dispenses the amount you need right into the bowl on each flush. Those big bleach tablets end up ruining your components in the tank. They make your bolts rust and the rubber gaskets deteriorate. This system doesn't do that. Takes all of about 3-4 minutes to install. The refills only take about 5 seconds to twist and replace. Refills last about 3 months at my house. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Does help keep the toilet clean, but you will ...
customer_reviews.text: Does help keep the toilet clean, but you will need to clean the toilet every once in a while. Definitely need to make sure you have the unit properly installed and check it periodically. Does help, though, so I will keep using.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieD

customer_reviews.title: Solid concept, poor preformance.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but it doesn't work. I have used bother the Blue (original) and the Green(septic safe) cartridges and both leave a brown haze in the bowl. It was worse then before. It doesn't streak as much but there is an even brown haze in the bowl. The cartridges last for a almost 2 months of turning the water blue. No real notice on a scent. I guess i could try the white cartridge (bleach) before giving it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Product is not as it's Presented/Stated
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 blue & was easy to set up. However, when flushing it's clear, no scent, & doesn't clean toilet or leave sparkly as presented/stated. Thought this was finally the answer, Not True I'm still having to clean toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Medina

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL. DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I am switching back to the neverscrub. This product had no bleach whatsoever. I started with a clean bowl, and after only 2 weeks it is filthy. Whereas with the neverscrub, I started with a dirty bowl and it cleaned it for me AND kept it clean for over 3 months. Will definitely NEVER buy this crap product again
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hetrick

customer_reviews.title: great concept but incompatible with my TOTO toilet valve
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this product and tried to install it on my TOTO toilet. Within minutes I knew it wasn't going to work because water does not flow out of the TOTO valve port (shown in the photo, where the fluidmaster "in" valve is connected). Water fills the tank from a valve port that empties into the tank through the gray floater box, and I cannot connect the "in" valve to it because the floater box surrounds that valve port. I spoke with customer service about this and they confirmed their product is simply incompatible with this TOTO model of the float cup valve assembly.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Never use tablets again
customer_reviews.text: Initially it didn't work with my tank setup, previous homeowner installed wrong fill valve. After replacement I installed this system and love it. My problem was those tank tablets (bleach) destroy a toilets tank seals and this removes that risk and there's no chance the tablet will clog the flapper. It is simple to install, clean and easy to refill and works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not for a Toto Toilet
customer_reviews.text: The water in the bowl on my Toto toilet did not fill up to normal levels after installing this. It seems that the Toto fill hose has a larger diameter than the Fluidmaster fill hose.
customer_reviews.author: jsbig

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do much
customer_reviews.text: It made the water blue but that's about it. Toilet get dirty at the same rate as before.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel F.

customer_reviews.title: CONSTANTY CLEANER TOILET
customer_reviews.text: The kits were easy to install. I installed 9 of these in the last 5 years. No tool required. During one install, I broke a flimsy fill valve. The service call plumber, as he replaced the valve, cautioned me about chlorine damaging metal parts. Then he examined the Flush 'n Sparkle. He agreed it would function as stated. And it does.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: MY HUSBAND INSTALLED IT. IMMEDIATELY THE WATER TURNED A DARK BEAUTIFUL BLUE. I THOUGHT OKAY THIS IS GOING TO WORK. FIRST FLUSH AND THE WATER RETURNS WITH A VERY PALE HINT OF BLUE. AFTER THAT, BACK TO WATER. IT DID NOTHING FOR ME. HIGH PRICE TO PAY FOR SOMETHING THAT DOES NOT WORK.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and works well
customer_reviews.text: I really like these! I was given a bleach one from a friend and really like it. The bleach one definitely puts off the bleach smell but the blue one is awesome. I don't smell it. Not to say it doesn't have one. I just rarely can smell. It's very easy to install. The blue dosent stay blue. It turns clear after a while. So far it seams to work pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Dalyupcowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: If you want to add some color to the water on your toilet for decoration well this is the perfect product. It doesn works,my toilet get build it even when I cleaned twice a week. And the bottom part of the toilet tank container stair getting s is me rust on it.
customer_reviews.author: Yasminee

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the toilet clean
customer_reviews.text: What ever the blue stuff is, it turns into gelatin. It plugs the cartridge up, gums up the container, and plugs the line up. Removing it causes the gel to drip out and begin staining carpets or rugs in the bathroom. Would prefer this with ingredients that are less obstructive.
customer_reviews.author: ppostma1

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install! Check your toilet before you buy!
customer_reviews.text: It took me 2 minutes to install this system and it works flawlessly. The cartridge releases a decent amount of cleaner and it smells fresh. Do check your toilet however, as mine fills mostly from the bottom up, the cleaner doesn’t actually run down the sides of the toilet to give it a good clean but that was a mistake on my part and my toilet still stays cleaner longer and smells nice So 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Selina R

customer_reviews.title: Tube too short for my tank
customer_reviews.text: Cannot use unless supplier sends longer tube. Toilet back flush to wall cannot attach to back and tube too short to place on front or side
customer_reviews.author: krkyoldhag

customer_reviews.title: It actually worked!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff actually works! We live on land with well water and have to replace filters often. The water tends to stain out toilets. We were bleaching them daily to get rid of the stains. I bought this product just to see if it would work, I figured it couldn’t hurt to try! There have been NO water stains in our toilet since we got these a month ago! I’m back to cleaning the toilet as normal without scrubbing daily. I will definitely be buying this on a regular basis!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Seems to fit my Toto Drake toilets
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to fit my Toto Drake toilets (the tube was only slightly different, but I think it will work ok). In my opinion, the blue dye is too dark, but that is personal taste. I may try the Chlorine refill cartridge, which is clear (but probably has a chlorine smell).
customer_reviews.author: school play

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peezy installation
customer_reviews.text: The company is correct. I installed this on my Kohler toilet in about one minute. I expected some sort of problem with the installation but boy was I wrong. It is simple and straight forward with only two hoses to connect. I've ordered another one for my other toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Card Recipient

customer_reviews.title: Don’t suggest
customer_reviews.text: Won’t buy these again. Bought 1 for each toilet. One fill hose was linked in package making bowl refill slow to refill. Second worked for a minute but now is also slowing the refill of the bowl. Still noticing stains in the bowl after flush so don’t throw away your brush.
customer_reviews.author: BarnzE

customer_reviews.title: sparkle automatic toilet cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT I SAY DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF JUNK. THEY ONLY THING IT DID FOR MY TOILET WAS MESS IT UP BIG TIME AND HAD TO HAVE A PLUMMER M
customer_reviews.author: Martha A.

customer_reviews.title: Works to keep toilet clean and odor free.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these, one for each bathroom. One has an old large volume water flush, the other low volume 1.6. The low volume has always had odor and cleanliness problems and needed to be cleaned frequently. The fluidmaster was easy to install and has made a huge difference. I'm very satisified. Slight bleach smell after first installing, but it subsides... besides, I'll take the bleach clean smell over the stall urine smell any day.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H.

customer_reviews.title: I've been using these for years.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought new ones for my new toilets. Easy to install. Works well. I like the slightly bleachy clean smell but it also dissapates after a few days if you dont. Plus the bleach works better than the other options they have. They save your tank seals because bleach goes down the pipe into the bowl instead of in your tank water, where bleach erodes everything but your tank. Bleach refills last me about 2 months with normal use by 2 people. I like the idea on someone elses post suggesting small chlorine or bromine tabs for way cheaper refills.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C

customer_reviews.title: Too many tubes for me
customer_reviews.text: I already have an “in” tube and it’s not easy to remove without damage. The one this came with isn’t either. I feel like that’s a flaw in the design. It should be easily removable while also hard to come apart on its own in case people like me already have a tube we don’t want to damage (I’m renting).
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Used unit pawned as new.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new product and was surprised it was used. How do I know? The tubes were routed incorrectly and already attached to the barbed orifices. Fun fact when trying to route tubes already expanded by barbed orifices it is a pain to route them through holes meant for their original diameter. It can be conquered by getting some of the tube in and then twisting.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: A clean bowl is a happy bowl
customer_reviews.text: Clean my toilet witch every flush WITHOUT have to scrub it? I’m sold! This does the job very well. Home Depot down the road from my house recently started carrying the refill cartridges there so I’ve been purchasing them from the store rather than online.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Expensive toilet cleaning bleach. Doesn't work as well as traditional toilet bleach tab at a much more expensive price tag Pro Easy to install Con Expensive Refill are expensive Doesn't clean that well
customer_reviews.author: kenji815

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do a thing except make the water colored.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a little less cleaning of the toilet but not the case at all,,,save your money, not worth it at all! Very disappointing! All this is good for is coloring the water in your toilet but no cleaning Automatic Toilet Bowl Cleaning happening whatsoever :-(
customer_reviews.author: TBL-NM

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for all toilets
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that it didn’t work for my toilet. My open tubing has an additional piece in it so I was unable to properly attach the water spout. It wouldn’t go down the tube and my water wouldn’t stop running. I had to turn off the water to take the device out to reinstall the old tubing.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Alexander

customer_reviews.title: CHECK ON OTHER ITEM FIRST
customer_reviews.text: ITS OK BUT I FOUND A SYSTEM AT MENARDS I USED YEARS AGO WHERE YOU PUT YOUR OWN PRODUCT IN A CUP INSIDE THE TANK. I LOVE BLEACH WHITE TABLETS NOT THE BLUE AND I BUY THEM AT THE CHEAPEST PRICE AND PUT THEM IN THE CUP AND OVERALL ITS CHEAPER AND WORKS WAY BETTER. GO TO MENARDS AND GO TO THE AREA WHERE THEY HAVE TOILET PARTS ANDASK A CLERK OR LOOK. THIS PRODUCT IS OK BUT THE REFILL IS EXPENSIVE.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES W STEEGE

customer_reviews.title: Too Stinky
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 3 stars because it does what it is supposed to, keep your toilet clean. It was easy to install (took less than 5 minutes), and works as designed. However the bleach version is simply too smelly to be used in a home setting. Within 1/2 a day the bleach smell had moved out of the bathroom and into the bedroom to the level it made our eyes water. We removed it as it simply isn't healthy to be breathing in chemicals at that concentration. We pulled the unit we installed and are returning the others we didn't.
customer_reviews.author: MarchBrown

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work on my toilet.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say there’s anything wrong with my purchase itself. But it won’t work on my toilet, so is still in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: They do work.. Provided your toilet has a tube connected to the pipe, with water flowing through it.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately when I attempted to connect these in my current toilets, I found no tube connecting to the overflow pipe. I flushed, and found no water coming from the existing ball-cock assembly. I have used these in the past, and can verify they work well. I will purchase new Fluidmaster kits for the toilets, and bring them up to a little more current standards.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Electronics

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Toilet Clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Bleach type because I didn't want a fragrance. Occasionally there's a very little scent of bleach but I seldom notice it. It helps to keep the toilet clean. I've already bought the bleach refills, I will continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vannae

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing
customer_reviews.text: I had to repurpose my original hosing to install this so the cleaner would go into the drain and not into the tank. Although the toilet water turned blue, it did absolutely nothing to prevent toilet ring. Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: L. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy install!
customer_reviews.text: i bought four of these for our bathrooms. Installation took 30 seconds and they work exactly as described! I am glad to finally be done with the old blue/bleach tablets that you would put inside your tank. The Fluidmaster Flush and Sparkle is FANTASTIC! Give it a shot as you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: azolivas

customer_reviews.title: Does not do anything...
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the ass to install, on 2020 American standard power flush toilet.. hoses are to short, so i had to get more from hardware store.. What really;y piss' me off after all that it does not work CANISTER must be empty!!!!! or dryed out...
customer_reviews.author: 1999 Poncho

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my toilet snow white. My complaint with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my toilet snow white. My complaint with it is that it reduces the water allowed into the bowl. I recently upgraded the toilet into the 21st century and it only takes 20 seconds to refill the tank after flushing. The diameter of the tubes connecting this product are smaller than the diameter of the tube that came with the toilet. This allows less water into the toilet's bowl. Been using it for a month and no problem with flushing things and having them stay flushed. Will continue using this product. This is the clear version.
customer_reviews.author: more peace

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: So far this bad boy has kept my toilet clean and smelling good. It was a little tricky installing because my toilets were a little different. Thankfully, they fit and I am hoping this can save me time from cleaning weekly.
customer_reviews.author: The General

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up and it doesn’t work . I don’t know if I did something wrong but I followed the directions
customer_reviews.author: nana1212

customer_reviews.title: Fluidmaster Flush N' Sparkle Toilet Bowl ~  WRONG!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worthless. They make the toilet water blue in various shades with flushing, but DO NOT CLEAN your toilet, quite the contrary. I used in two toilets, same result and not easy to install, very messy.
customer_reviews.author: nvj3wlv

customer_reviews.title: super easy. The only unknown is how long the ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to support my Fluidmaster dual flush system. Not a fan of blue tinted bleach, but this model was cheaper. Had concern about bleach in my tank damaging the parts. This drips the bleach into the overflow tube that goes directly into the bowl. It only took 2 minutes to install. No tools, super easy. The only unknown is how long the bleach canister lasts for our usage. If I can get 3 months from a single cartridge I'll be happy. Bought extra cartridges to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lowtech

customer_reviews.title: Less Work!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for over a year. Introduced it to my Son's home and my Sister's. So easy to install and keeps cleaning to a minimum. Doesn't harm tank as product bypasses tank direct to bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Does OK job.
customer_reviews.text: You must clean toilet before installing or no help. It did OK job after that t - I have septic, it tends to regulate how much water goes down, so occasionally it would block due to not enough flow/too much TP
customer_reviews.author: Tajsultani

customer_reviews.title: Works great - easy install - easy refill
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Clips on - You can adjust the box up and down on the clip - Each flush has bleach in it - easy to install - easy to add a refill Cons: - connector hose may be tight to install, dip it in hot water to soften it - hard to know when to add a refill
customer_reviews.author: Price Charlot

customer_reviews.title: We have tried to use Chlorine bleach tablets in our ...
customer_reviews.text: We have tried to use Chlorine bleach tablets in our toilets to control bacteria growth, but they destroyed the internal mechanisms. These work well because the bleach doesn't sit in the tank and degrade components. Instead, the bleach solution is fed directly into the bowl of the toilet and keeps bacterial growth under control. No more pink and black stuff in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Howard A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great system. One of the toilets in my house has a tendency to grow a disgusting mold ring around the bowl at the water line. I hate it. We would usually have to take the brush to that bowl several times per week. No matter what I tried, it would not inhibit the growth. We tried bleach tablets, other "automatic" cleaners, nothing worked. This system works like a charm. The bleach insert keeps the dreaded mold ring away for months! The blue inserts don't do much at all besides color your water. Doesn't inhibit mold ring growth.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Blue goo
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 1 week. Quite producing blue color. Check cartridge. Blue goo around cartridge and in holder. Rinsed and reinserted. Worked for a few flushings then same situation Tried replace cartridge and same situation. Called Fluidmaster. Said old cartridges been sitting on shelf. Stop using. Fluidmaster sending replacement. Is Amazon sending defective products? Will see when get directly from Fluidmaster.
customer_reviews.author: Linda McAllister

customer_reviews.title: Works great with minimal modifications!!
customer_reviews.text: For those with an updated fill/drain system in their KOHLER toilet tank. I noticed the tube supplied doesnt fit well from water fill end to the fluid master system. So I just used the original hose and tapped into the fluid master system and stuck the supplied exit hose into the fill end as shown and works like a charm. No major mods needed!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Leo

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working
customer_reviews.text: We've had these in two toilets for two weeks. They seem to be working as advertised (our toilets are staying clean). The 'scent' is unnoticeable with the seat down, but if you leave the seat up for a bit the bathroom smells like men's bath products (not in a bad way, but noticeable).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long!
customer_reviews.text: What is the return policy on this item?? It's been in the toilet (Maybe) less then a month. First there was to much blue, now I know why the color did not last. I thought this was good for about 3 months? Well it doesn't last very long at all. I have 3 toilets with 2 adults living in the house.
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the Flapper
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this product back in August of 2018 and replaced July 2020. This cleaning system is easy to install and replace the chlorine cartridge when needed (About three months). The main reason I switched to this system from dropping chlorine tabs inside the tank was, the flapper deteriorated and caused the toilet to leak after a couple of weeks. The replacement has larger/thicker hose and hopefully the case is more durable. The old one developed a pin hole leak in the housing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: This device is very easy to install, and it makes perfect sense for the bleach to be injected into the bowl, rather than the tank. Bleach tablets in the tank ruin the flapper valve in short order.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Have
customer_reviews.text: These little gadgets are just what you need if you're fussy about a clean toilet. I used the drop tablets, for years, and my husband finally got tired of replacing the toilet insides, from chlorine rot. I found these on Amazon and trusted the great reviews. Ours have been installed for several years and our toilets stay super fresh. One major comment, the tablets that come with the unit don't dissolve well. Ditch them and buy some regular pool tablets. There's a world of difference. You'll see.
customer_reviews.author: HAC

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage is what this is and where it ended up. After two weeks of little to no blue water, I check the unit to find it completely clogged and blue cleaning tab all swollen inside case.
customer_reviews.author: Angella Blackwell

product_meta.title: Fluidmaster 8300 Flush 'n Sparkle Automatic Toilet Bowl Cleaning System, Bleach
product_meta.description:
Style:Bleach Cleaning KitThe Fluidmaster 8300 Flush N’ Sparkle Automatic Toilet Bowl Cleaning System takes the hassle out of keeping your toilet clean. A self-cleaning toilet bowl system that eliminates outdated and damaging tablets and liquid cleaners. The universal design fits most toilet models and installs in just a few minutes. Step by step instructions are included for an efficient DIY project that keeps your toilet bowl clean and stain free for up to 3 months. Refill cartridges are available in bleach and other cleaning solutions and are sold separately. Designed to be a superior solution to tablets, by placing a cleaning solution directly into the overflow tube and eliminating damage to flappers and other toilet tank parts. Relax and let the toilet clean itself with the Fluidmaster Flush n’ Sparkle self-cleaning toilet system.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Fluidmaster is the #1 toilet repair brand in the world. Since 1957, we have been guiding our customers to the right toilet repair solutions. Fluidmaster is dedicated to making the installation of its products easy and simple with a complete line of toilet repair parts including: fill valves, single and dual flush valves, flappers, tank levers, toilet seals (bowl wax and wax-free), toilet repair kits, flush valve seals, connectors and more. Fluidmaster parts are found in more toilets than all other brands combined. Fluidmaster distributes to over 90 countries and is the trusted brand by toilet manufacturers and professionals worldwide.
feature_bullets: Eliminate hassle and work with this self-cleaning toilet system!
Universal design bleach cleaning system that fits most toilets.
Scrub-free and hands-free cleaning without damaging toilet parts.
Replace outdated cleaning tablets and liquids.
Environmentally friendly system that cleans your toilets for up to 3 months.
Replacement cartridges available and sold separately.
Clean your toilet with every flush.

specifications.Included Components: Fluidmaster 8300 Flush 'n Sparkle Automatic Toilet Bowl Cleaning System, Bleach
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,592 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
